Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: DandDAustin
Reviews.Content: If you just saw the rooms and the lobby, you wouldn't want to stay there but the bar and the restaurant provide a fantastic experience even if you are not a thirtysomething. The outdoor bar overlooks the Dallas downtown light show and is a great place for people watching. The restaurant menu always provides lots of surprises and we have copied several of their appetizers for preparation at home. We have stayed there a half dozen times and it has always been a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the Dallas skyline!”
Reviews.Author: Hniki234
Reviews.Content: This is a cute boutique hotel that we'll definitely stay at again! The regular rooms aren't anything spectacular on their own, but our view of the Dallas skyline was AMAZING! The bed was comfortable. Friendly service from staff. Our friends reserved a suite which had a wonderful balcony with a hot tub (again, with great views of the Dallas skyline!). We'll definitely go back to this hotel, but we'd change one thing...we'd book the suite!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Naomi D
Reviews.Content: The Belmont was fantastic. By far the best place in Dallas, I barely felt the need to leave the hotel at all. The pool was great, especially in the evening with 'Dive In' movies. 'Smoke' the adjoining restaurant, the best in town and the bar had the best views over the Dallas skyline. Luckily I scored a room with skyline views as well. My room was spacious, clean and homely. The staff were helpful and even dropped me off in town and picked me up when I was done with their list of suggestions. Although I wasn't overwhelmed by Dallas itself, the Belmont was the saving grace of my stay, I'd almost go back just to stay at the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Guest”
Reviews.Author: TXbeachbum76
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Belmont over a dozen times during the past 3 years... most recently in December 2011. The Belmont is a great alternative to the giant, cookie-cutter chain hotels in nearby Downtown and by the medical center. The ambiance at the hotel is great. I am usually there for a few nights, and it is a great place to go back to after a long day and unwind. Great patio, great pool... and the staff is amazing. The food at Smoke is really amazing. So maybe its not in the greatest neighborhood, but if you're looking for a place to crash, eat some of the best meals ever, and have a DIFFERENT experience... this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: SivaH
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Oak Cliff and I watched the Belmont transform from a run down hideout for homeless people to a great little retro spot. The area is Oak Cliff, however, so there are pockets of run down neighborhoods. It's not like driving through Uptown or Park Cities where you find a nice hotel surrounded by nice homes. Oak Cliff is still transforming. But don't let that scare you. Plenty of people are migrating to OC now and The Belmont has a great little bar to meet friends and hang out. The Bar: the bar is a nice place to get drinks. Prices run from $8-14 per drink. I think most of their drinks come out nicely but I always think Dallas bartenders could use a lesson in making a good strong drink. The Belmont is no different in that area. Regardless, there is a nice, small sitting area inside and a larger patio outdoors with a skyline view. You can also walk to the pool and there is a grass lawn you can sit on with the #1 best view of Dallas. The Hotel: The hotel is overpriced and not worth the money. Their nicest room (The Terrace Suite) is about $500 a night. That competes with a room at the Ritz and for the money & service, you get a FAR better deal at the Ritz. If you're going to compete with the Ritz Carlton, you better step up your game, Belmont. The Terrace Suite (which I have stayed in twice now) is cute but stripped of any frills. It's not charming. It's just there. Furniture, decor, amenities; it's all on par with a normal motel. The bed frame falls off if you accidently hit it while climbing into bed. It has a hot tub, yes, but it's never hot enough. For $500, I expect more than a lukewarm tub of water and a broken bed frame. I think customer service should be judged on everyday service but also, and almost more importantly, on the service you get when you are unsatisfied with something. In that area, the Belmont lacks greatly. If you have a problem, don't expect the Belmont to step up and give you immediate, great customer service. I had a recent stay in the Terrace Suite and had an extremely disappointing experience. Four people in our party complained in person and after hearing nothing back from the Belmont, I finally wrote a formal letter of complaint. I have yet to be contacted personally with feedback about that letter. I believe the assistant manager, after a week and a half of verbal and written complaints by our party, offered half off our next stay. This was after I contacted the hotel manager and she told me "oh, he (asst manager) must have forgotten, I'll remind him to call." I find it ridiculous that it took four different people complaining, a formal letter on my part, and a reminder to the hotel manager before we received feedback from the Belmont staff. On top of that frustration, the Belmont offered a coupon that holds no value for us since we already told the manager we would not be back in the near future because, 1) we all live in Dallas and 2) we were only there for a special event. The real issue is that after what we experienced, we do not want to come back. Not only do I think I will waste my money on another room at the Belmont, but I do not trust that if I have a problem with my next stay that the staff will take the initiative to solve my issue in a prompt and appropriate manner. I have included the letter I sent to the manager of the hotel below. "Dear Ms. Spagna, I grew up in the Oak Cliff area and I along with my family are regular, returning customers to the Belmont. On Friday the 20th, I attended a bridal party located in the Terrace Suite. During our stay, we had repeated noise complaints against us from the woman in the adjoining room of our suite. She became so aggravated that she banged aggressively on the adjoining room door, shouted profanities and called us names --. This was reported to your staff that evening, Jerald, who took no action against the womanâ€™s verbal abuse. We considered the matter closed so you can imagine our surprise and embarrassment when the police arrived while the bride was showering and guests were in their pajamas. The Belmont Hotel was aware in advance that this was a bridal party and that, according to the hotel's own staff, the other guest had a history of noise complaints throughout her stay. The hotel staff member inspected our suite and confirmed there was no music, loud games or alcohol. The fact is, a small group of five women arrived late following a concert Friday night and the noise was not atypical of any hotel guest arriving to their room (doors opening/closing, people talking about sleeping arrangements, toilets flushing, etc.) Half of our bridal party was asleep immediately following the concert and any noise the woman in the adjoining room may have heard consisted strictly of four women speaking at a normal volume. The lack of concern or effort from your hotel staff, Jerald, was extremely upsetting. After presenting my valet ticket to him upon departure, he gave me the wrong set of keys. He then laid out all the keys in which he had possession (20 sets) and told me to â€œpick one.â€� You can imagine how this act of disorganization and carelessness looks to a guest trusting your hotel with their car. It was a blatant lack of security. When Jerald finally did pull my car around, he opened the door and walked away, leaving the car running with the door open in the middle of the road. Jerald did not return to the lobby to notify me the car had been pulled around so it sat in the road running, door open, without my knowledge. The manner in which the incident was handled by the hotel escalated rather than resolved the matter and, in fact, prevented us from full use and enjoyment of our quite expensive suite. As a result, the entire bridal event was highly diminished by the experience. We are particularly upset in view of the significance of the event not to mention the fear caused from a verbal assault by one of your hotel guests. We would have gladly accepted a comparable accommodation in another suite had it been offered. The entire bridal party was extremely apologetic not only the night of the event but also on the following Saturday and Monday. However, we do not feel that anything we did warranted the verbal assault from the other hotel guest or a visit from three policemen. The bridal party would appreciate the hotelâ€™s attention to this disturbing matter and compensation for our embarrassment and inconvenience." If you do decide to stay at the hotel, just make sure your car keys aren't being strewn out for other hotel guests to pick from.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMT2213
Reviews.Content: This is not a boutique hotel, it is a retro motor inn / motel. There is a difference. I was really unimpressed by the housekeeping. Over the course of the six days that I stayed there the bathroom amenities were never replaced. I had to call the front desk on two occasions for more shampoo and conditioner. It's fine if they don't want to replace it everyday, but when they are empty in the trash it should be a signal to leave more. The housekeeper actually left the toilet paper roll empty. ?? The area around the motel is also a bit sketchy. The grounds of the restaurant, bar, etc feel safe, but plan to have a car if you are going anywhere else. One last thing.. it is not quite at night. The vent in my room was so loud and created a suction with the door so it sounded like a constant howl. One the weekend there are loud people outside and I swear there was a police with sirens on going by every few hours. Being that most of the rooms are on the ground level the noise is inevitable.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Retro Hotel - Best View of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: CaptDefeated
Reviews.Content: We've been going to the Bar Belmont for a couple of years now but had the chance to stay in the hotel for the first time recently. Basically this is a cool retro boutique-style motor inn just a few miles from downtown Dallas. The rooms are simply appointed with modern furnishings and interesting color schemes. If you want something plush The Belmont probably won't fit, but if you want something cool this could be a good place. Some rooms are inside and some have parking lot access. Overall it seems like they are all a good deal for this type of hotel. The views of Dallas and the new Trinity bridge make it worth it - even for locals.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful 1940's Motor Hotel with excellent views and amazing pool”
Reviews.Author: SchulzeM
Reviews.Content: This beautiful 1940's motor court hotel is where I stay anytime I'm in Dallas. It's one of my all-time favorite hotels in the US. They've taken a classic old motor court hotel and completely renovated it. It is wonderful. Each room in the bungalow section of the motor court is roomy with a bed and bathroom and small flat screen. The interior is a bit minimalist, but it completely works. Regardless, you shouldn't spend your time in your room anyway. Each bungalow has an attached covered patio so you can sit and enjoy the amazing views of the Dallas skyline and the beautiful landscaping around the rooms. Cactus, Hollywood juniper, fire grass, and other plants make the courtyard lush and peaceful. Perhaps the best part of the hotel is the pool. The pool is surrounded by black bamboo and that amazing view of the city. It's heated and has a wall at one end with a waterfall. Swimming at night is the best time to enjoy it. I haven't stayed in the main building which I believe is a more traditional setup with rooms off a hallway. In the main building is a hotel lounge and patio with more views of the city. The hotel is off the beaten path at first glance but Dealy Plaza (JFK assassination location) and downtown are only 3-4 minutes away straight up the street. Ft. Worth Avenue runs right into Commerce. It's a great motor hotel that you just won't find anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation lacks frills, attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: jd294
Reviews.Content: The property looks stellar from the outside with the white stucco walls and beautiful views of downtown. But if you're looking for the Dallas version of Austin's mod motor court, the Hotel San Jose, you'll be somewhat disappointed. This renovation lacks the same attention to detail that Liz Lambert took with the San Jose's. Instead of polished concrete floors and Bertoia chairs, the rooms sport thin rec room carpet and original cracked bathroom tiles. The effect feels unfinished rather than charming. My room also had a balcony, but instead of outdoor furniture, it featured only industrial black rubber mats. In terms of the basics, this place was clean, the staff were friendly and the value was good. It's also a super spot if you plan to spend time in the Bishop Arts District or downtown but want to do so without having to deal with Dallas pretense or the W party vibe. In short, I would recommend it but with the caveat to manage your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to like the Belmont but..........”
Reviews.Author: TravelFloo
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love the Belmont, but I simply did not. A friend and I spent a weekend there in October of 2011 and we were put off from the minute that we arrived by the cooler-than-thou attitude of the staff. Upon entering the lobby and approaching the desk for check-in, the clerk turned her back to us and began a conversation with another person in the back office. Essentially, the same thing happened when we checked out, though this time with another clerk who didn't even thank us after completing our payment. What's up with that? Why run a hotel if you're too cool for the guests? Some clerical errors were made as well, leaving us locked out of our room one day and without maid service another... these were remedied but with caveat that the errors weren't really their fault........whatever. Rooms are sparse but comfortable -- we knew that going in and so were OK with it. And the location is simply not great, but we knew that going in as well, so can't complain. On the other hand, we had a remarkable dinner at Smoke, the associated restaurant. It was just wonderful and I'd go back there in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views, stylish decor, and employees who care”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug35
Reviews.Content: It's not often you find a hand-written welcome note on a hotel bed, especially when the hotel is at 100% capacity and packed to the gills with two separate wedding parties. Of course, one could dismiss a little note if they didn't receive the top-notch service we experienced! The hotel sits atop a hill overlooking downtown Dallas and if you like mid-century modern architecture, you'll love this place. They converted the old motor lodge parking pads next to each deluxe room into cozy little patios for outdoor relaxing. We found three adorable little geckos on ours. :) The pool was closed for three hours on the evening of our visit for a wedding, which might have been an annoyance but wasn't for us. If pool use is very important to your group you might want to call ahead and make sure it'll be open. The two large wedding parties the day we were there made things a bit crowded, but I enjoyed seeing all the dresses. We used the complimentary shuttle (an Escalade!) to a nearby concert and the driver went above and beyond for us. He drove us through a lovely neighborhood and explained the history of the hotel. He also refused a tip! There were a few negatives- the wedding parties drank up all the coffee the next morning and there wasn't any to be had. Also, the upper parking lot where we parked above the restaurant turned into a mud pit after a rainstorm, which made getting out of there a messy prospect. (An email to the hotel regarding the mud was answered with an apologetic phone call and promise to have the parking lot repaved.) Great hotel run by great people. The up-scale BBQ restaurant next door is a big plus, too.

Reviews.Title: “A good alternative to the big box hotel chains”
Reviews.Author: recur
Reviews.Content: What always bothers me about going to Dallas is that the majority of hotels are huge and without any personality. In those hotels you feel as though you could be anywhere, North, South, East or West. Belmont is the other side of the coin: an older, remodeled hotel with lots of Texas personality. Many of the rooms have excellent views of the Dallas skyline, it's worth asking for at booking or check-in. Attached to the hotel is the very excellent "Smoke" self-described "artisanal" texas BBQ restaurant. What the Belmont has going for it is it's uniqueness, and the feeling of an old history while being completely clean and new at the same time. It is in a rather out of the way location. It's a short drive to DFW or to the center of Dallas, but it is nonetheless not really near anything else of note. I'll stay here on my next Dallas trip.

Reviews.Title: “My future Dallas home away from home”
Reviews.Author: rangercatfish
Reviews.Content: I stumbled into this place looking for the companion restaurant, Smoke, and couldn't have been more pleased with my stay. It was Texas-OU weekend, and they only had a couple of rooms left, but I toured the property, and it is a really charming renovation of an old standard originally opened in 1946. Prices are reasonable (for Dallas), and the view of the Dallas skyline is truly superlative. I found the staff to be young, friendly, and helpful (not always the case when younger people are taking care of older grumps, but they seem to understand getting old is not for the faint of heart). I can finding nothing to criticize, and everything to praise, and this place will be my choice for stays in Dallas from now on. If you go, tellem Catfish sentcha, and be sure to eat at Smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, convenient to downtown”
Reviews.Author: LindseyLu1219
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belmont for OU/TX weekend, and had a great experience. Not only did it cost half what a West End hotel would have cost, but we were close enough to take the hotel shuttle downtown on Friday night, and still far enough to have a relaxing, intimate dinner in the Bishop Arts District on Saturday. It was the best of both worlds! The hotel was cute and eclectic. We had a hand-written welcome note from the manager, a view of downtown and normal overhead lighting, which I really appreciated. I hate how most hotels just have lamps. One tip - If you stay in the main bulding, request a room away from the bar. We were right above it and it was very loud until last call every night.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & Arrogant”
Reviews.Author: kaladis
Reviews.Content: The good - Excellent views of the skyline of Dallas. Cool renovation of an old landmark. The bad - The staff, from the waitresses at the bar to especially the front desk, couldn't have been more full of themselves. They projected an air of pretentiousness, as if it was my privilege to be there amongst them. For all the good things about this hotel, the customer service ruined my experience. When you pay this much, you expect the staff to at least act as if they care about anything. Cool rooms, but I definitely won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff who go the extra mile to help you.”
Reviews.Author: SallyFromSydney
Reviews.Content: Having read a so many great reviews we decided to book the Belmont for our two night stay in Dallas and what a delight it was. From the moment I called to book the friendly, can do attitude of the staff was evident - they couldn't do enough for us! The hand written welcome note from the general manager with recommendations on what to do based on my booking conversation was a really nice touch. The hotel is a restored art decor place, whilst it is close to a busy intersection you don't hear a traffic sound in your rooms. Great value - you dont need to worry about not being down town the free shuttle service was beyond our expectations - luxurious and of course friendly and helpful. Even got to see the NBL trophy on display at the bar with the city views behind in the distance one night. Would certainly recommend the Belmont.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual and Fun”
Reviews.Author: luvstotravelanywhere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belmont on a Thursday evening. It is clean and the staff is accommodating. The only thing that bothered us was the smoking on the veranda outside of the bar. It would have been nice to sit out and look at the view. the smoke wafted into the bar are also, making it an unpleasant place to be. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “What is not to LOVE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely a treasure from the Decco decor to the beautiful view of the Dallas skyline. We stayed in Suite #41 and I would repeat that choice again. It has a nice little balcony to sit and enjoy the view of the city and take a minute to just relax. Our living room area was very nice and comfortable and came with a nice galley wet bar separating the bedroom. Our bed was extremely comfortable and the entire suite had great room darkening blinds. The Belmont Bar is by far the coolest place in Dallas to sit and enjoy a drink and take in the city sights. When we arrived there was a "jam" session going on inside the lobby bar area to add to the ambiance. The Belmont has a cooperation with the restaurant SMOKE next door, so with our cocktails we dined on some awesome barbecue sliders.I did not take my bathing suit, but I wished I had since there is an adorable pool with a poolside bar to make it complete! We actually only live thirty minutes away, but it is well worth the expense staying at the Belmont to see the city. If you stay on your actual birthday they also help you celebrate with half off of your room rate which is a very nice touch. I would suggest the Belmont to anyone wanting a special evening.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the ordinary hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Quarterflash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights last week. The temperature outside was 108 but the rooms were super cool. Stayed in a little bungalow with a terrace overlooking the road. Loved this place, it's quirky and the clientele were equally lovely. Staff were very friendly. Great city views from the pool. If you fancy something different from a Marriot type chain, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic escape”
Reviews.Author: NikiBP
Reviews.Content: The Belmont's Terrace Suite is the ultimate getaway - all the luxuries for a night in with a view of Downtown Dallas and in a uniquely hip and comfortable setting. Enjoyed an amazing dinner at Smoke, cool live music at the bar, the pool and health club â€“ a truly memorable night away.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ihandfull
Reviews.Content: The Belmont Hotel was cute and friendly. We had a quiet room all the way at the end of the hall on the 2nd floor. I think if we were on the 1st floor or closer to the staircase on the 2nd floor, it would have been much noisier, since the sounds from the bar carry down and up. Positives: Nice sized room Great closet size Hot water runs forever Room has long desk/table area and an extra chair Good room service from Smoke Restaurant Away from hustle of city but still close to many things to do Friendly staff & guests Bar is fun to hang out in Room for improvement: Floor tiles in bathroom looked really dirty. It could be that they are just old and carry that charm, but I never stepped in there without socks on. Rooms overall are dark. The overhead lights, lamps, and bathroom lights are all pretty dim. While the room is functional, it's definitely minimal as well. This is fine for me, but for someone who wants some personality in their rooms, it's not quite available, at least in the room we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, best view in the city”
Reviews.Author: dallasbill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent our 27th anniversary there. We stayed in room 55, which has a fantastic view of the city and the newly completed Margaret Hunt Hill Bridge. The room was spacious and nicely decorated with beautiful colorful photos. The decor is simple and understated. We were warmly greeted when we arrived. I took advantage of the pool. Later we met friends for drinks at the bar. The service was friendly and efficient. We had brunch at Smoke, the restaurant next door and had a great salmon and collard green eggs florentine. this was a very relaxing spot. There's self park which is free. Others used the valet, but the free parking worked fine for us. I left my phone charger in the room and immediately got a call from the hotel letting me know. Great Stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CassieMolassie
Reviews.Content: We live in Dallas and just needed a night away. I was very pleasantly surprised to pull up to the Belmont and find it so charming. It is landscaped with native plants and feels like it belongs. The rooms are sparse but nice. We had a room with a great view of the Dallas skyline. We hit the pool both days we were there. Drinks from the bar were outstanding. I can also highly recommend the nearby Smoke restaurant. Delish. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “I dream of it.”
Reviews.Author: WALTZ_ACROSS_TEXAS1
Reviews.Content: Like going back in time, and into a movie, set in southern California. Felt like I was going to see a star walking by at anytime. It's a down home kid of place, not ritzy. From back in the day when there was a tiny carport next to each room. Now those ports are outdoor sitting settings, overlooking downtown from across the river. The Belmont is not in the hustle and bustle, nor is it in a pedestrian friendly area. In fact the neighborhood is a bit off putting, but once you climb that drive you're in a whole 'nother place. Love the bar and lobby. quirky - cool. Restaurant across the drive, just the other sideof the bamboo.

Reviews.Title: “For the hip scene of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Bbrooks74
Reviews.Content: This place is completely different from the chain hotels of downtown or the over-priced "boutique" hotels of Up-Town and North Dallas. It's fun, funky and a great place to meet friends for a weekend getaway. The bar is one of the best in Dallas with the most incredible view of the Dallas skyline.

Reviews.Title: “A great welcome to Texas”
Reviews.Author: Yambagal
Reviews.Content: This was our first night of a trip to 4 states. After a long flight from Australia we found the Belmont check in staff to be welcoming and efficient, and appreciated that the directions given from DFW were easy to follow (even on the 'wrong' side of the road!) It was convenient to have a store right across the road to stock up on snacks and water etc.We enjoyed a drink in the bar area and ate at Smoke. Perhaps the BBQ flavours and sauces were just a bit much for our first night of Texan food, as we were both unwell afterwards. We parked in the free car park up beyond the restaurant, which was fine. The pool area was lovely, and although we didn't swim, it proved a great area from which to view the specatular Dallas skyline at night. All in all this hotel provided everything we needed (except breakfast), and had a great atmosphere as well. It's proximity to the city makes it a good compramise and good value. We had no trouble driving into the city the next morning - but it was a Sunday! We had a 'garden' room I think - which was very quiet. As valet parking uses the space around the rooms, we did hear cars being driven in and out- but it was never a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and cool hotel that delivers”
Reviews.Author: FamilyofthreeSydney
Reviews.Content: Loved this beautiful retro motor court hotel. Sleek modern rooms with original bathrooms. Just the right mix of original and new. Absolutely gorgeous pool. Great bar and happy hour. Very Quiet and comfortable. An unusual location - kind of out on its own - but having said that, it was really close to downtown and very close to a great little neighbourhood with cool shops and cafes and restaurants. Make sure you eat at the very cool Oddfellows on W 7th street, about a five minute drive away. Personality plus hotel and we got a great rate. A great find. Loved it. The only thing I would change is the very surly check in staff - not sure why they are so dreary and rude - perhaps they think its cool to be rude?

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway...”
Reviews.Author: DanNell
Reviews.Content: The part of town that the Belmont is situated is right between Hmm... and Oh Great! to the west are some neigborhoods in dire need of renovations and rejuvenations. With that said, we loved that we weren't far at all from the West End and some great restaurants, but most of all that Smoke restaurant was on the premises. We enjoyed the quiet atmosphere of the Belmont. To call the Belmont sparse or minimal doesn't do it justice whatsoever; we loved the modern simplicity of the room and the adjoining patio (a former carport transformed to a stylish, almost zen-like privacy patio). I loved it so much I did my morning stretches in my jammies there. The queen-sized bed was comfortable and the room tastefully decorated in a retro style that wasn't at all comical. The modern TV was TINY and the closet could've used a light switch, but they were the teensiest flaw in an otherwise fantastic experience! Funny enough, we managed to lock ourselves outside onto the patio one morning and their staff responded quickly to get us in our room!! the staff were very professional, knowledgeable and weren't overly chatty. They were almost transparent... in a way that made our stay uniquely about us and the hotel that much more in the forefront. I was a little concerned about parking so far away from the room, but our car was safe in a lot adjacent to Smoke. The grounds of the Belmont are rich with greenery and the gentle sound of a trickling stream; it always made for the best strolls with my honey. The Belmont's patio off the lobby was alive with singing and music but not bothersome in our little bungalow located to the back of the grounds. The Belmont is a romantic, unique twist on the motor hotels of the 1950s but still gave you that step back in time without any goofy theatrics. Having Smoke nearby rounded out our experience perfectly. We can't say enough about the diverse and delicious meals we had at breakfast and lunch. [You MUST eat the Heavy-Handed Blueberry and Ricotta Cheese Pancakes - no syrup needed!] The most stressful part of this trip was leaving the Belmont. We plan to return and hope that we have the same joyful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, modern, comfy, but not pretentious.”
Reviews.Author: mobster78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time this week and it has become my new Dallas spot. The W is too cheesy, Zaza WAY too cheesy and go figure, the cheapest out of the three has better service and more character. The rooms are basic, but nicely appointed with retro modern style furnishings. It kind of has a W Miami style feel with outdoor entrances and marvelous landscaping. The hotel bar is nice, but wasn't crowded when I was there. However, the view from the patio is great as was the view from my room (deluxe in the bungalow section - $139). Smoke is the adjacent restaurant and is great if you like meat and whiskey. They have other things, but that seems to be the two most popular items. All in all a cool hotel. Cool enough for me to waste 10 minutes writing this review at least.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot.”
Reviews.Author: bloft
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel with just the right mix of trendy and comfortable. I've stayed here twice, in two different types of rooms (basic and jr. suite), and both were clean, roomy, and comfortable. The staff is helpful and pleasant. The restaurant -- Smoke -- is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: CM_wines
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my husband's birthday, we spent the night in one of the wonderful garden rooms. Friends met us for drinks at the outdoor bar and the view of downtown Dallas with the setting sun is wonderful. For dinner, I highly recommend heading next door to Smoke,like our group did. Our hotel room had a killer view of downtown Dallas and we loved the private "porch room" off to the side of our hotel room. Not only was it a comfortable and private place to relax outside but it also made for a quiet sleeping arrangement since each hotel room was separated from the other. Our bed was very comfortable and we loved the trendy atmosphere. If you don't appreciate the retro touches stay somewhere else. Otherwise, you won't find a more fun and friendly place in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RG10095
Reviews.Content: Not luxurious but comfortable. I was there for 5 nights with husband, 1 year old and extended family. I missed some practical features like larger bathroom with counter space and refrigerator. We were comfortable and staff responded to needs. We only dined at the restaurant once as it was pricey and limited menu but there are plenty of other dining options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Old Motor Hotel Still Is...”
Reviews.Author: Pfaffers
Reviews.Content: Now I know you non Texas folks probably assume that any hotel is hot in the middle of August in Texas. You'd be wrong. The Belmont however was. When we arrived at a little past 3pm the room was 78 degrees and there was a box fan already running and propped up on the night stand. First clue this would be a bad experience. The room temperature rose to 80 as the afternoon got hotter, I'm sure the views are lovely but you'd be crazy to raise the blinds. I'm sure the pool is also nice, however apparently they rent the pool space out to private parties so we were unable to cool down there. By 11pm when we finally demanded our money back, the room was still 80 degrees. The staff was apologetic and immediately refunded our money without a fuss. However, I would still say this hotel is way overrated and overpriced. Outside of the temperature issue, the garden room we were in is a far cry from other hotels in the area we have stayed in that are in the same price range. The grout in the shower and on the bathroom floor was mildewy etc. and the bathroom door had thick patches of paint complete with streaks and drips, the shades were frayed and had a few holes in them. This place started as a motor lodge, a place to rest your head on your way somewhere else... I'd say despite new paint, and a hipster bar, it still is. Some reviews have lauded the "minimalist style" no it's not minimalist, it's just cheap trying to pass as a four star "boutique" hotel when in fact it's just a gussied up roadside motel.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to coming back”
Reviews.Author: YorkResident
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Belmont for a little R&R and alone time. Was very impressed with the adjacent restaurant, "Smoke". Service was a little bit inattentive, but the food was outstanding. I had one of the garden rooms away from the main building (#34). It had a big comfortable bed, white-tiled bathroom, and a cool balcony overlooking the street below. Swam some laps in the pool (most hotel pools aren't long enough to do that; this one is), and enjoyed the view of the Dallas skyline from the property. Good service, peaceful & quiet on a week night. Might be noiser on the weekend, but I'm looking forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “Ummm... No.”
Reviews.Author: jpetralia
Reviews.Content: The Belmont Hotel in Dallas charges the rate of an upscale luxury hotel, however provides the comfort and amenities of a Super 8. And all of this is done under the guise of being "trendy". Some of the highlights: -Bad neighborhood. -Unpaved path from the sidewalk to my room (gravel). -Bed which was 2" off of the ground. -Paper thin towels. -12" TV .. TWELVE INCHES. I fell asleep watching Hulu on my laptop because the TV was too small to see. -Plastic seating (think "Little Tykes" children play furniture). -Very limited and difficult to negotiate parking. -Futon instead of sofa in the living area -- and a very uncomfortable one. We were booked for 5 nights and ended up staying for just one. Abject failure in being the trendy luxury hotel it claims to be.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven, but I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: AustinTravelMama
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Belmont twice. One trip was great; one was not. It depends on the room. The first time I stayed in one of the detached rooms lining the driveway. I liked the little screened porch and the minimalist/retro feel. It was quiet and comfortable, so I wanted to come back. The second time, my room was in the main building, just off the open stairway from the front desk and the bar. While I like the bar, the bar noise penetrated the room and I found it hard to sleep. I've talked to very friendly, helpful front desk people, and more reserved staffers. I think the beds are fine and I like the bedding. The pool area has wonderful views of downtown and is a great place to hang out while the sun is doing down. To me, the location is good because it's near I-30, and it's easy to get to lots of parts of Dallas. But it's not a walking-around neighborhood. The detached parking doesn't bother me, and you can always do the valet thing. The Belmont is a cool, funky place, but it isn't the best choice for travelers who want to be pampered. I would go back again, but I would make sure to get a garden room.

Reviews.Title: “A Cool hotel, in the heart of Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: prettykitty80
Reviews.Content: This is our fav place to stay when in Dallas. Hands down. Great service, cool rooms, fun bar and at a decent price. It's easy to get to our "go to" places in downtown Big D, Irving and Grapevine since the hotel is so close to I-30 & 35E. We brought along our dog for the 1st time, she loved walking around the property. The renovated restaurant is super cool! They do the local produce thing with a fun spin from the well known local chefs. The menus are even cool! Love the breakfast choices, eclectic & hard to choose just one! Good service, yummy food and I LOVE the decor in the dining room. The bar at night is hip & happening, fun atmosphere, good bartenders & LOVE the outdoor patio with the Dallas view. My favs at the Belmont: The coffee, the front desk staff, the local featured art on property and room 60

Reviews.Title: “I like it”
Reviews.Author: rekab3136
Reviews.Content: This is as others have stated a converted motor lodge. It is close to downtown but not right in the middle of everything which is nice. As mentioned by others, there's a nice view of the skyline and the rooms are decorated in retro 70s or 60s stuff which is quite nice. The rooms are small. Also, to me it's not particularly kid friendly, for example when you enter the front door at night the bar is right in front of you, so lots of people drinking/loud noise as you encounter the stairs up to the 2nd floor where we were. No big deal, but with smaller children this might not be ideal. Also, we valet parked, which cost $15 more, not sure how it is for self-parking. The swimming pool is heated, it is attractive, there are walking paths. The staff is friendly and helpful. Overall, I would definitely go back without children, with children I might also go back, though I might look at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, nice and noteworthy”
Reviews.Author: ragnhild156
Reviews.Content: The Belmont made it on our top-rated list! Highly recommended for a Dallas getaway. The room is minimalistic, but it has got all you need. Clean, simple and with a view do die for of the Dallas skyline. The hotel bar is a hang-out for locals and guests alike. The restaurant Smoke is great. It's next door and serves as the breakfast/lunch/dinner-eatery. The location is somewhat out of the downtown area. You'll need a car to get easily around town. But the friendly staff, the cool architecture and access to both a professional gym and pool makes this a Dallas-gem. We even got a two-page list from the front desk with things to do and see while in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool but Style over Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Bittco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for everyone- it is VERY different. I have never seen a more no-frills hotel room and that is what makes this place work. If a luxury hotel is all about fancy amenities this place is all about a simplicity going back to its origins as a motor lodge. All the furniture was barely a step up from a basic box. There were no drawers and just a simple old style alarm clock. This style isn't for everyone epsecially those accustomed to bells and whistles but if you are looking for an out-of-the-way spot and something different then this place is totally worth a visit. The staff was exceptionally friendly and the rooms not too expensive. The location isn't great but it is close enough to the city to get to without much issue. The internet was free as was parking unless you want valet. The self-parking may not be a good idea if you have a nice car since its off to the side.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable. Outstanding service. Like staying at someone's home!”
Reviews.Author: MerchantsBarter
Reviews.Content: Myself and three business associates stayed in Dallas at this hotel for almost two weeks. We already were expecting a fantastic view of downtown Dallas - which btw is spectacular and worth the price of the stay alone! - What we didn't anticipate was that ALL of the staff without exception treated us like royalty. We stay in hundreds of hotels around the world and we can all say that this was a refreshing change from the stiff and stuffy chains that just want your money and wear a fake smile. There's nothing false or fake about the Belmont, it's exceptional. As a tip, take a dip in the beautiful pool at night and admire the incredible view of downtown Dallas... bliss!

Reviews.Title: “Possible great, reality yuck.”
Reviews.Author: jeaneneAustin_TX
Reviews.Content: The views of Dallas skyline are beautiful, no other like it in the city, but that is literally all this hotel has going for it. The service in the bar was horrible. Waited ten minutes and then had to go to the server station and asked for help. Grumpy waitress who acted annoyed. Decor is worse than IKEA, walls in main are paper thin, only food for 2.5 miles is the restaurant next door and while it smells great it is not! Better off staying at an Embassy and saving money for the other great boutique hotel on your trip. ** Good note, after writing an email after returning home, the manager wrote back with an apology. Nice touch. In no way like the San Jose in Austin.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel outside of downtown”
Reviews.Author: lowens311
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit outside of true downtown. The views are excellent and the place is super quirky. This place is not lush, but more of a modern IKEA type feel as far as furniture and fixtures go. We got this through priceline super cheap and then were offered a garden room with a patio and deck for $10 more, so we took that. The upgrade was nice...great deck with views and a nice window seat in the room. Bathrooms are tiny and minimal. If you can get this place at a good price and you have transportation in and out of the city, it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Quick to trip to the big D, disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kortnjoe_w
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I recently took a quick trip to Dallas. We both attend college in Tyler, just two hours east of Dallas. We decided on a spur of the moment deal to head to dallas for a night, get a room, and just enjoy the weekend. We got there and were sadly disappointed. The Belmont is a cute, quaint hotel with old-time charm. You can tell they took an hold hacienda style motel and tried to make it fancy. The rooms are small with no real amenities, hard beds, small bathtubs, and tiny tvs. For over a hundred dollars a night it is a waste of money. I won't lie when I say we had to try it once, but we will never go back. We could easily spend less and get a lot more from a Hampton Inn or Holiday inn express. Another note, it's $15/night to valet since there is only like 5 parking spots available in the entire hotel. fyi

Reviews.Title: “An eclectic experience that I don't care to have again”
Reviews.Author: GigaJiga
Reviews.Content: Really cool, hip hotel in Oak Cliff (aka Dallas ghetto that people want to call the new "up and coming" area). The Belmont is certainly an experience worth seeing. When I arrived I was taken to my room (the smallest/cheapest) and upon walking in and seeing the minimalist, non plushiness, I immediately walked downstairs and asked to be moved. I was moved out to one of the bungalows with the screened porches. Same room, just a screened porch, which in my room wasn't even attached. The rooms have a bed that is stiffest thing I've ever felt, a plastic "desk" chair pulled up against a table thats about a foot wide that also holds the tv, and one other chair. For someone like me staying for 5 days, this is not really ideal. I live out of my hotel room and I had no where comfortable to sit. The parking is terrible, you actually have to park on the other side of the restaurant which means you are walking down/up a hill everyday to and from, as well as lugging around my laptop and bags. In addition, being a single woman traveling, I really did not feel safe parking so far away at night and walking by myself up to the hotel. Also the bungalows are off the main building so their "wireless" internet was non existent. I never was able to make a connection. I did visit the pool which is really cool looking and has a great view of the Dallas skyline. I never found a gym if there is one. The maid never refilled my soap/shampoos, and there is nothing in the room as far as information on hotel services, room service, near by restaurants, etc. Another plus is the beautiful gardens that surround the bungalow rooms. Mostly rosemary, the garden was pleasant to walk through every day. Apparently the hotel bar is a popular place at night, so expect to see lots of cars taking up parking spaces, as well as lots drunks stumbling out of the bar and wandering around the property checking it out. Am I glad I saw the hotel, sure. Would I stay here again, no way.

Reviews.Title: “Caught us by suprise, is this Dallas?”
Reviews.Author: paulandlauren
Reviews.Content: We booked the Belmont at the last minute to attend the opening for the Smoke Restaurant. The hotel has a unique feel, very similar to something you would find in Austin. If your looking for really nice plush rooms, this is not the hotel for you. The rooms are very minimalistic but I found that it went very well with the grand theme of the entire hotel. Pretty cool outside/inside bar area, very urban and very full. We just booked a basic room, for the price and atmosphere it's worth the visit.(Don't forget to eat at the restaurant if there..very good)!

Reviews.Title: “Good - Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Drujon
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased that the old Dilbeck motel was saved and turned into the Belmont. The finish out was done quite nicely and the public areas are beautiful. My room was very "minimalist" to say the least. I understand that they were going for that feel and probably didnt have a huge budget but the plastic chairs and in-door-out-door carpet is a little much. The bed was okay, about par for a 'value' hotel. The room was very clean. Overall I'd say the Belmont is fine for the Hipster crowd that doesn't need much more than a place to sleep that is cool and trendy but as a destination hotel the Belmont comes up short.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and food, clean room!!!”
Reviews.Author: saturnbay
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about my choice because it is off the beaten path where I normally stay in Dallas. I come here twice a year for the gift show at the world trade center. However, the staff was welcoming, friendly and helpful from the front desk staff, room service staff, valet and shuttle drivers to the wait staff at the Cliff Cafe. Everyone here is so pleasant! The food from the Cliff Cafe on property is AMAZING...SOOO good!!! Really good value! The room has internet for free, it is clean, simple, they recycle. It is an authentic Texas style hotel with history and character. I want to stay here everytime I come to Dallas. Although, I would not recommend walking around at night...it is an up and coming neighborhood that is not TOTALLY there yet but well on its way.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Blast at the Belmont!”
Reviews.Author: AFBT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Belmont for a friends 50th Birthday Party. We wer e in room 49 but the party was held in suite 51. Our room was a little stark. The bed was ok but the dark blanket at the end of the bed was stained and had to be removed. The view from that room is a great view of Downtown Dallas. We didn't get road noise but we heard our neighbors. The toilets have a power flush so we were awakened a couple times by our neighbors flushing. The window covering is a roll shade that was broken so it didn't keep the room dark. The bathroom was clean and the towels are oversized and nice. There is a SMALL shelf over the toilet and ony one hook. Thank goodness my toiletries bag can be hung. It's a 40's hotel but everything has been replaced so it looked retro. The room where the party was held was perfect for a party. There was a wet bar inside and a large patio with a hot tub. We all partied on the patio with the great view of Downtown to talk about. The valet is the best way to park your car. They are super nice and very helpful. It's not a great area of Dallas so you don't really want to self-park across the street. I think it was $15 to valet overnight but all in and out is free. The hotel lobby was cute and the staff was awesome. They have a very popular bar that is a cozy place to visit with friends. There is modern art on the walls, warm candlelite and a great music playlist. The pool area looked cool but I didn't get to spend any time there. For breakfast we ate at The Cliff restaurant on the property. I was amazed at how good everything was! Great biscuits and Gravy, pancakes, good bacon and their breakfast burrito was wonderful! This place was fun and retro. If you need luxury, go someplace else but we had a great time. Take it at face value. It's a 40's motel turned funky hotel. It's clean. Relax.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: Truthshallsetyoufree
Reviews.Content: I planned a stay at the Belmont Hotel thinking it would be outside the typical hotel mold and a unique experience. Well, it was unique alright, and a mistake I will never make again. I don't know how this place gets away with charging more than $60 a night. The room was poorly insulated so you could hear the neighbors two doors down coughing. I don't think I need to expound to implicate what else you could hear. There is no privacy, the carpets are stained and disgusting, the tv is flatscreen but about 20", the beds basically have towells for covers and provide no warmth whatsoever (not to mention they were stained). The worst part was the trucks. The road next to the Belmont is quite trafficked at night and my wife and I could hear every single one that passed by as if we were lying next to the road. The window shades were retro indeed gave almost no covering so the room never got dark. I got no sleep. The next morning we waited 20 minutes past the time when they had promised breakfast in bed, only to find out it consisted of cold toast, and old fruit. For the valentines package we got disgusting truffles and a "romantic candle" that smelled like dishwasher soap. The bathroom consists of a poor attempt to place a toilet a sink and a bathtub in as small a place as possible. Needless to say, the next night we booked with a less expensive, higher quality hotel. Skip the unique experience and go with a clean place where you can actually get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A quirky, comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsonian
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Belmont on recommendation from our Dallas-based employee. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the nearby restaurant has excellent food at a reasonable price. This is a 40's era hotel that was renovated and has some quirks. My room was reasonably quiet but I could imagine if the hotel was full this could be a noisy place. The room was immaculate though a bit sparse. The bathroom is small (due to the era) with a tiny shelf for all my toiletries - careful, its directly over the toilet! Give the Belmont a try if you're tired of the cookie-cutter hotels and enjoy the personal, unique touch it offers.

Reviews.Title: “hip and fun hotel - we're anxious to return!”
Reviews.Author: irishmm
Reviews.Content: What a refreshing "blast from the past." My husband and I stayed at the Belmont during the Texas/Oklahoma game weekend, on October 11th. The hotel was booked to capacity (note to self: book early for next year's game). This was our first stay at the Belmont, and we loved the hotel. Because of events related to the State Fair and the football game (Texas Longhorns now ranked #1!), we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel, but we did walk the grounds and ate at the Cliff Restaurant next door. In short, we had a wonderful experience. Despite the hotel being fully booked, or perhaps because they had planned for it, the staff was available and responsive, and we felt well "attended," from the valet staff, to the staff members who drove the shuttle that took us to the bus station to catch a bus to the Fair, to the front desk and housekeeping staff. Mandy was especially considerate and helpful. Nice to see someone who keeps their cool on a what was almost certainly a demanding weekend, and seems to actually enjoy her job. Our room was basic, a room outside the main building in the old motor court area. The room was fresh and clean, and quiet (as we had requested). The bathroom was older with updates and sparkling clean, with large fluffy towels. We added the "romance package" to our stay, which included a nice French Brut champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries. The menu at the Cliff Restaurant was varied (light eating to full dinners), and our dinners and desserts were delicious, with super-attentive and friendly waitstaff. Room service is available from the Cliff. Valet parking is (or was, on this weekend anyway) $15.00 per night, and not free as we had expected, although the in-and-out was free. We used the valet since the parking was more secure, although there is a self-park lot next door to the Cliff Restaurant. We're already talking about returning to this charming restored hotel. If you like a hip, retro hotel (with a few key modern conveniences), and with staff that actually seem to enjoy working there, check out the Belmont. We predict you'll arrive and leave with a smile on your face. We did.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: justalittlecrazykc
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, we almost didn't book the Belmont based on some of the reviews about the neighborhood it is in... Give me a break! I've seen scary neighborhoods and this is NOT one. Besides, the hotel is secluded. Upon arrival, the valet knew who we were and which room we'd be in.. He was great. Front desk was great. Room (we stayed in a suite which, I think, was more or less a double regular room) was great. Bartender was great. Restaurant was great. (Note: There were a couple downsides... The wonderful view of downtown we had hoped for from our window was blocked by a tree and the complementary high-speed internet wasn't working)... It's a pretty cool spot - a completely redone motor court... Here's a tip: Don't waste your time driving downtown to eat - eat at their restaurant... We drove around on a Sunday night looking for something to eat and finally just came back and ate there - it was fabulous. We had breakfast there the following day as well... If you're borderline...or pondering staying somewhere downtown instead..stop it. Stay here instead - I'm glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Very Interesting and Fun”
Reviews.Author: jammclree
Reviews.Content: My wife stays at the Belmont often when she is in Dallas. She has a much more free spirit then me, so I wanted to check it out. I found the hotel to be a lot of fun. The pool and bar are fantastic. It is great for people watching. Everyone was friendly. The restaurant was great. Rooms were ok. Bathroom needed updating and was small. If you are open minded and like to have fun I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not My Cup of Tea”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for a "deluxe room" at a rate of $120 per night. I found our room to be small and claustrophic. The one chair and two tables in the room were plastic patio type furniture, not the least comfortable for sitting and talking or watching television. In addition to the room, there was a screened porch next door. The porch was not connected to the room by a door, you had to exit the room and walk around to the porch which I found very odd. The porch consisted of one small window, a concrete floor, one chair and an ashtray. Certainly not somewhere I would want to spend any time. My husband was definitely not impressed and asked that we leave. Some people obviously love this place because there are many good reviews. Just not for us. We left and went to the Hyatt for about $25 less.

Reviews.Title: “Funky & Cool, but Standard Rooms are loud”
Reviews.Author: aknight
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Belmont last weekend and found it to be a really hip and cool boutique hotel with a feel very unique to Dallas. We've experienced a lot of pretentious people in Dallas, but not at the Belmont. And who knew North Oak Cliff was so great? We spent some time driving around the Kessler Park area and walking around the Bishop Arts District... definitely cool places. The hotel was clean and well decorated (minimally on the inside, with art and scultures outside). It is fun to just walk around the grounds and look toward downtown Dallas. The landscaping is done really well there. Also, the pool is heated and located overlooking the city with a little grassy area to hang out. We also liked the bar and the outdoor patio. They bartender opened an hour early to serve my wife and I Saturday afternoon drinks. Also definitely try the Cliff restaurant next door. It was packed for brunch on Sunday so probably best to call ahead. The food was really good and we enjoyed the atmosphere. Our only complaint was that we booked a standard room because that was all that was available (although a great deal at $109). It was in the hallway right next to the lounge and was pretty loud late at night and early in the morning. While the rooms have been renovated and cleaned well, it looked like they should have taken more time regrouting the bathroom tile to make it look a little cleaner. We will definitely be staying at the Belmont again but will not book a standard room. Most of the other rooms are not attached to the main lobby, so we will try them next.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hipster Belmont Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cchivian
Reviews.Content: Although i do live in the same city as this hotel I decided to celebrate my birthday there! I am glad i did. This hotel is on top of a hill in an underdeveloped area with great potential. If you are used to brand new, squeaky clean, plush hotels, i'd read below before i make a decision to stay a whole weekend: First off, valet, it's free! Even for guests. You will check in and since some of the rooms are located in different areas the Valet will drop you off with their golf cart. The hotel is atop of a hill and spread out. It is sort of like it's own little village so there are no hallways! Belmont took this old 40's building and rennovated it but left its charachter in place. It has some of the original fixtures, tile, and concrete walls. Props to the owner for leaving it that way but modernizing it with the decor and furniture. I rented the loft suite! I cannot say that i've been anywhere that had a view like this. You could practically touch the Dallas skyline with your fingertips. It's gorgeous! It had 2 floors, downstairs was not large at all only to fit a day bed and wall length desk, flat screen, countertop with sink and a bathroom with a stand up shower. Upstairs was much larger, queen size bed, daybed, wall mounted flat screen and bathroom with standup shower. i read that someone thought it was in a sketchy area, not true. Why would you even walk off the grounds, it has everything you need! The hotel was very accomodating about having guests over. It has the BarBelmont which had flawless service, and a skyline view as well! Like i said i stayed in the loft so i'm not sure if everyone will have a view like ours so ask to be placed in a suite that will. Few more tips: infinity pool, ice machines scattered among the property, landscape was pretty, 5-10 minutes from downtown, 15 min from greenville ($18-20 cab ride one way). CliffCafe for food service. would i stay again? Already thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel, Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: BlondeMafia224
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Belmont several times in the last year and have had a great experience every time. The atmosphere is fun, funky and fabulous. The staff is friendly and laid back and the rooms are cute with both original and modern elements (original tile, new flat screen TV) put together. Great view of downtown skyline from bar patio and pool area. The Cliff Cafe, their onsite dining spot, has delicious pulled pork quesadillas and a good wine selection. You can get breakfast all day too if you want. The Bar Belmont is a cool place at night for a drink or snack. The area is surrounding the hotel is not great, but I felt safe walking around every time. It will get better with time. They have security that patrols at night. Another bonus: they offer quick complimentary shuttle to the Bishop Arts District or Downtown for more dining and shopping options.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dmqdallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for Valentine's Day and it was fine as long as you did not have to deal with the staff. They are not good when they get busy. The Valet did not have us on the list and gave us a hard time when parking. No one carried our bags and we definitely did not get a bucket of ice like another reviewer did. The bar was busy with one server. She started out ok but then disappeared. When we asked for another drink, she finally did bring it; slamming it on the table. We said something to bartender inside which got us the response from the server of "I am not ignoring you, I am just busy". We sent an email to the hotel and at first the representative seemed helpful--wanting to talk by phone. However, she did not seem to believe us and then said she would get back to us. She did after I emailed her 3 more times. Her email basically told us too bad that we were disappointed. We live in Dallas and I bring in business clients often. I was hoping that the Belmont would be a good addition to my list. It is not. And we will not be going back to stay or even for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Rainy weekend retreat”
Reviews.Author: kajrdj
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Belmont (husband and I first went in Nov. 2006). Fully renovated rooms boast all the amenities from mainstream hotels but with historic nostalgia. Unique atmosphere, fresh, youthful decor, attractive lounge with fresh flowers and bohemian accents. Comfortable bed with waffle coverlet and fluffy pillows. Cramped bathroom with pedestal sink--only room for one at sink. Deluxe room (no. 34) had a window seat overlooking terrace with mosaic sidewalk. Didn't use balcony since it rained while we were there. Valet very friendly and helpful. Morning breakfast at Cliff Cafe, just next door to the hotel...vanilla bean pancakes and florentine egg scramble--delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Adventures in Gansta-Land”
Reviews.Author: TxTravelPro
Reviews.Content: My friend came to Dallas for work and I told her about this place which I had read about. She got a reservation and we decided to meet for dinner at the hotel on her second night. I was waiting out front of the hotel restaurant (overlooking a Dollar General Store) watching for my friend to walk down the hill from the hotel and there was this group of crazy looking gangster types walking down Ft Worth Ave (very bad area) they were just hanging around, drinking out of paper bags. They were scary and I just froze as they approached. I was not sure whether to run or scream but I just stepped backward towards the door. One of the guys rushed towards me and got about 10 feet from me so fast. He thought it was hilarious. Tattoos on the face and neck and visibly wasted. He walked away and threw down his paper bag/bottle. I managed to duck into the restaurant, which was really pretty. But I was still worried about my friend because these people were just walking around out there and hollering at the other â€˜ganstasâ€™ driving down the street. She made it safely. Dinner was ok but service was painfully slow and they were out of the entrÃ©e I ordered. I only found out they ran out after waiting for my meal. They were a little unorganized in general. Waitstaff was nice. So I went back up the hill with her to see her room. Cute bungalow that was correctly represented on the website. The only problem is that it backs up to some big construction site and they start working early each morning. Later I walked back down to the parking lot and hurried into my car. My heart was pounding. It is just a dangerous area. It did not help that on my way out I commented to an employee and they just chuckled and said that the area IS bad and they see a lot of crazy stuff. The parking lot is mostly dirt and concrete chunks. It all seems so out of place. I got out of the parking lot and headed towards the highway and what theâ€¦ a freakinâ€™ sheriff is behind me with his lights on. I was worried but I had done nothing. He IDâ€™d me and was friendly enough. We chatted for a few minutes and he said that they check a lot of people in the area because of â€˜problemsâ€™. He thought I was someone who possibly just stole a car. OK. Well I got the heck out there! Bottom line, I think the place is kind of cute but I just donâ€™t know if it is worth risking my life to go there at this time. It looks like it will be gentrified in a year or two. Loads of construction and lots of space for sale. Maybe I will check it out again in 2010. Until then I will recommend that out of town friends stay in the uptown area.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, exceptional service - a gem!”
Reviews.Author: DEN31
Reviews.Content: I haven't been here but an hour or two and I've already found my new home away from home in Dallas. Bear with me, this will be a long review, but I think the beauty of the Belmont is truly in the details... I'm in a Garden Standard Room ... #38 to be exact ... a corner unit with 3 windows (on 3 sides of my room!!) and a gorgeous view of the Dallas skyline. It looks like a small apartment - I even have a chair out on the front "porch" of my unit. The room is adequately sized and a touch minimalist with the decor - very comfortable, and decently appointed. Just finished a delicious dinner at The Cliff Cafe, the onsite restaurant. I'm now enjoying their signature "Belmontini" in the lounge and using the free internet access. The staff is ridiculously friendly. From the valets (complimentary parking with your stay and they carry your luggage to your room and bring you a bucket of ice) to the desk staff to the waiter at the restaurant to the bartender - it's evident that the staff here are genuinely pleasant, and very concerned about providing a positive experience for guests. Don't let reviews about the neighborhood bother you. There's not much around - yep, it's transitional, and in a few years this place will be surrounded by condos and a Starbucks. Matter of fact, the guy who owns the hotel owns more land around here and is working very diligently to bring the neighborhood up. (Search for an article in the Dallas Morning News from about a year ago if you don't believe it.) In the meantime, enjoy a bit of an oasis! Do not stay here if you are looking for the standard, same-furniture-as-the-hotel-I-stay-at-in-every-city-I-visit. If you want a big chain hotel, for heaven's sake, stay in one - you'll get exactly what you've come to expect. If you want a historic, quirky property that preserves the original 1940's motor court architecture updated to modern, comfortable, affordable standards, by all means, contact the Belmont. If you want to stay someplace where you find a handwritten welcome note waiting on your bed on arrival, beautifully landscaped grounds, and the friendliest staff in Dallas, just visit their website and book a room. I think next time I'm here I'll try one of the 2 story lofts.....they look fun...

Reviews.Title: “Fast Times at Belmont High”
Reviews.Author: Crankee
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. The staff: Every employee my travel companion and I encountered greeted us with a warm smile and immediately inquired how they could be of service. The hotel: Beautiful! Rooms have a feng shui decor. Our room was spacious and we had a screened porch with a view of the immaculate landscaped grounds and a skyline view of downtown. Plantings were in shades of sage and lavender with spots of pink and red roses. The bar: Relax with a glass of wine and enjoy the glowing Dallas skyline. The restaurant: Had a filling breakfast. Had I been in town longer I would have enjoyed a lunch or dinner there. I would have to put this hotel in the couples/adult only category. Hip but not haughty. The staff is young and attractive. You will need a car or taxi (the hotel does offer limited transporation) to get to Dallas proper, approximately 2.5 miles from the hotel. There is also a heated pool that I enjoyed lounging around but didn't take the plunge.

Reviews.Title: “Ick”
Reviews.Author: royalgirl
Reviews.Content: Don't even waste your time! I booked a stay at this hotel just based on the website. I was in Dallas for a convention with one of my co-workers and was under the impression that our room would have 2 beds. Not a strange request so I thought...When we arrive to the room there was only 1 double bed. When I brought this to the manager's attention, she told me that there was only one room (out of the 67) that had two beds. So we opted to change hotels. The manager , a woman named Brandy, insisted on charging us for that night even though we weren't comfortable with the condition of the room. (Mold in bathroom, misleading on internet pictures.) She was argumentative, rude , unprofessional and very condescending. We finally left and waited outside in the cold for 45 min for a taxi Brandy called for us. We finally arrived at our new hotel at 1:30am tired and distraut. We stayed at the Indigo Hotel which was amazing and less expensive than the overpriced and underkept Belmont hotel. Moral of the story...never stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A college dorm is trendier than The Belmont”
Reviews.Author: travelsnob18
Reviews.Content: This place is hip if you're not in the know.... The "suite" that I stayed in during a holiday party was littered with budget decor & bad lighting. While the view was nice, it did not make up for the lack of luxury. This hotel is cute, but not hip. I've heard it compared to Hotel San Jose, Austin, TX, but it's far from it... Hotel San Jose is truly unique with custom details, not off-the-shelf flair. Plus (or minus as it may seem) it's located in a rough area... or "up and coming" as some may speculate.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Daisycrazy
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Belmont. The hotel is beautiful, unique, and clean. The staff was attentive and helpful, comparable to my recent stay at the Ritz. This hotel is a great value too. For $80 per night I had a nice-sized room (complete with ironing board, hair dryer, coffee pot, great toiletries, good water pressure), valet parking, concierge services from the front desk, access to a computer and printer, continental breakfast, and a car and driver (local shuttle service). In the evening the highly acclaimed Bar Belmont comes to life with interesting guests relaxing on a deck that overlooks downtown Dallas. We found it to be a great venue for socializing with other guests. I also loved the healthy choices offered in the complimentary breakfast--yogurt, fresh granola (the best I have ever tasted), and fruit. They also had an assortment of pastries and other items. Enjoying breakfast outside on the deck was a great way to start the day. The unique decor and impeccable service make this one of the best boutique hotels I have ever visited. I will definitely stay at the Belmont again...and again. What a cool little gem I have discovered!

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL!! good bar..”
Reviews.Author: traveler0821
Reviews.Content: Came in late and was greeted by what I assumed to be a drunkered...Later come to find out it was one of the owners. There was no place to put my clothes away, food is overpriced and terrible (the poor bartender had to keep making excuses for everything) and the only person who tried anything nice was that bartender Jose, who really seems to be the only one who knows what he is doing...Really the bar is great and the rooms are nice. Whoever designed those two aspects of a "hotel" were obviously the only ones thinking, btw, Belmontini is awesome, but overpriced.....Come, but don't stay

Reviews.Title: “Like the view, food and restoration”
Reviews.Author: llr43
Reviews.Content: We've been wanting to stay at this 1946 motor court since The Shape of Texas did a piece on its restoration. We were to attend a film party near the east end of Commerce Street, which runs through the heart of town and becomes Fort Worth Avenue before the entrance to the Belmont, a couple minutes west of downtown. The view in the evening is stunning, as the Belmont sits high enough to have uncluttered views of the lighted Dallas skyline from the right spots on the property. We returned just before the kitchen closed at 10 and enjoyed the last set of a band on the outdoor terrace, excellent pan seared goat cheese and mozzarella crostini appetizers plus wine. Then double chocolate mousse cake. Our corner room overlooked downtown and just north of town, was spacious, the bed firm and comfortable, the shower strong, Kiehl's shampoo, conditioner and lotion appreciated. Valet always was prompt with our car, never a wait. With so much to like it was puzzling that the room had no drawers, no light in the large closet, one bar of soap and the bathroom needed a better cleaning, an old razor found behind the toilet. With so much to like, maybe this was an aberration, but we hope more attention is paid to cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: grinkle
Reviews.Content: This is such a cool hotel, very "noirish", rat pack, 50's, space-age swingin' batchelor pad kind of vibe, with funky and artsy overtones. Very romantic if you're thinking of that kind of getaway with your loved one... great views of the city. I guess it's a little off the beaten path, but if you have a car you'll be all set. Check out the Bishop Arts district which isn't too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Hipster Hangout Dallas Style”
Reviews.Author: StardustRoom
Reviews.Content: We loved this little gem on the cliff. This old school 40's motor lodge looks like it has been plucked off of Route 66 or out of the Palm Springs desert and landed near downtown Dallas. The staff is comprised of Dallas hipsters (very nice, helpful, beautiful ones) with style and flair. We felt right at home right away. We were there for a casting call for a network television show and when the staff found out, they treated us like mini celebrities...even though we are just restaurateurs from Texas. Our standard room was very nice with a great view of downtown Dallas. Love the decor, mid century mixed with ultra mod. The bar is like a cozy den of some fabulous, creative interior decorator. The drinks are done to perfection and the bar appetizers and food available fits the surroundings (brie quesadillas, hummus, potstickers, anti pasta plates etc..). We were lucky enough to get a surprise call back and ended up having to stay another night even though we had already checked out. I called the Belmont as Dallas was under a heavy ice storm and asked if we could get another room and this time it even had a more spectacular view!! We recommended the hotel to another couple we had met during the casting and they ended up staying there too. The weather was terrible, it was a Sunday evening but the staff showed us a good time. Michael (?) grabbed the hotel vehicle (nice Escolade) and drove us over to the Mission district for a lovely dinner at a tiny tucked away Mexican restaurant. Vera Cruz has only 6 tables and it feels as if you are inside a tiny, beautiful jewel box. The food was good and the hotel hospitality was awesome. We plan to make this our place to stay on business or pleasure trips to Dallas! Thanks Belmont!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Use caution w/ Valet Service”
Reviews.Author: sarklystic
Reviews.Content: The staff and accomodations are fantastic. The rooms are very unique. The lounge and bar was awesome. The staff, during my stay, were great. However, I did experience some severe problems w/ the valet. I have a german car. On my key ring, I have a fob w/ attached key that has been deactivated as I thought I had lost it. I found it recently, and I had planned to take the car in to get the key reprogrammed the very next working day. I totally forgot to tell the valet guy about which key he should use to start it. Well, he used the wrong key. Instead of calling me when the car would start and then turn itself off (they screen said "Immobilization Activated), the valet guy continued to try to start my car w/ the incorrect key. I had my car towed to the dealership to deactivate the immobilization feature. PROBLEM: Because the valet guy tried to start it sooooooooo many times (30+ times), $1,000 in damage was caused. While I do not hold them 100% responsible for the damages (I should have had the foresight to instruct them on which key to use). Anyway... they are refusing to accept responsibility. All I asked is that they accepted 50% of the cost of the valet guys error. He should have called me immediately when there was a problem. I loved the hotel, but I am a bit put off in regard to how they are handling this issue. I had planned to make this hotel my new "spot". Needless to say, I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place off the beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: JRsNeighbor
